column4: ?spørgsmål nogle af jer der har installeret rails og rendt ind i problemet her: Installing ri documentation for rails-3.0.1...file 'lib' not found
Hi, have any one, had this problem when they installed rail in linux with gem: Installing ri documentation for rails-3.0.10...file 'lib' not found?
Which excat package did you apt-get install?
I used gem, because apt didn't have the updated version of rails
Ah.  And now it's complaining ri isn't there?
Wait. This is your first gem install on this box, right?
yes, and it will not work proberly without it
You need to install the dev ruby packages, and build-essentials, otherwise only the simplest of gems will install properly.
can I do it with apt or should I use gem
It needs to be apt, not gem, because it needs the header files and stuff
And probably apt-get install ri, just in case you dont' have that either :)
After you have ruby-dev (or ruby1.9.1-dev), and build-essential, and ri installed, then you can install all your other ruby libraries with gem.
I have installed the packages as you say but it's still the same
Check the ruby channel, I may be missing a step, but I had similar issues the first time I installed a gem on ubuntu.
